Package Grupo45.Projeto

Class Metrics

java.lang.Object
Grupo45.Projeto.Metrics
public class Metrics
extends java.lang.Object
Date May 07-2021 This program is able to extract metrics from all .java files in a given source. It analyzes the code of java files for the metrics 'Lines of Code', 'Weighted Metric Count', 'Number of Class Methods' and 'Cyclomatic Complexity' creating a .xlsx file with the data. It has a Graphical User Interface that also shows the analyzed metrics and allows users to create rules for Code Smells evaluation. The GUI shows the detected code smells for the given rule, and has functionalities of rule manipulation. This class has all the methods to manipulate metrics and Excel files
Version:
1.0
Author:
G45, AndrÃ© Amado, Guilherme Henriques, JoÃ£o Guerra, Miguel Nunes, Francisco Mendes, Tiago Geraldo

    • analyze

      public void analyze​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      This method analyzes each given file extracting the metrics: 'lines of code of the method', 'lines of code of the class' and 'number of class methods'
      Parameters:
      file - to be analyzed
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the given file dosen't exist or can't be found

    • applyRule

      public java.util.LinkedHashSet<java.lang.String> applyRule​(Rule rule, Excel e) throws java.io.IOException
      This method applies a given Rule to an Excel file, comparing the conditions with the excel values to check if the Rule is true and if the method is a Code Smell
      Parameters:
      rule - is the Rule that will be applied to the excel
      e - is the Excel where the rule will be applied
      Returns:
      returns a LinkedHashSet with information of all the code smells detected
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if it founds a problem getting the input file or the workbook

    • metricsToExcel

      public Excel metricsToExcel​(java.util.ArrayList<java.io.File> files, Excel e) throws java.io.IOException
      Exports the metrics found in java files to an Excel file
      Parameters:
      files - is the array of all java files
      e - is the Excel file to where the values will be exported
      Returns:
      returns the Excel file with all the metric values
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if it founds a problem getting the input file or the workbook
